page.title: 13TRANSPORT IN FYLINGDALES
page.content: We surveyed one hundred families in School to find what transport each used. We found that 12% had no car. The others did, some having one vehicle and a few families having two or three cars. One family owned seven bicycles and that was the largest number. 20% had two bicycles but there were eight families which did not own a machine. 83% of the families have no motor-bikes. A few families have one machine and four had two. 25% of the families have used the train to get to their holiday destination. 34% of the families have flown to other countries and 44% have travelled on a liner or a ferry to another country.
